intro: Dombeya ambatosoratrensis subsp. perrieri, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
